trans-unit.target: Backup

trans-unit.source: Copying VHDs from backup vault timed out - Please retry the operation in a few minutes.
trans-unit.target: Copying VHDs from backup vault timed out - Please retry the operation in a few minutes.

trans-unit.source: If the problem persists, contact Microsoft Support.
trans-unit.target: If the problem persists, contact Microsoft Support.

trans-unit.source: This happens when there is too much data to be copied.
trans-unit.target: This happens when there is too much data to be copied.

trans-unit.source: Please check if you have less than 16 data disks.
trans-unit.target: Please check if you have less than 16 data disks.

trans-unit.source: Backup
trans-unit.target: Backup

trans-unit.source: Could not communicate with the VM agent for snapshot status.
trans-unit.target: Could not communicate with the VM agent for snapshot status.

trans-unit.source: Snapshot VM sub task timed out.
trans-unit.target: Snapshot VM sub task timed out.

trans-unit.source: - Please see the troubleshooting guide on how to resolve this.
trans-unit.target: - Please see the troubleshooting guide on how to resolve this.

trans-unit.source: This error is thrown if there is a problem with the VM Agent or network access to the Azure infrastructure is blocked in some way.
trans-unit.target: This error is thrown if there is a problem with the VM Agent or network access to the Azure infrastructure is blocked in some way.

trans-unit.source: Learn about [debugging up VM Agent issues](#vm-agent)
trans-unit.target: Learn about [debugging up VM Agent issues](#vm-agent)

trans-unit.source: Learn about [debugging networking issues](#networking)
trans-unit.target: Learn about [debugging networking issues](#networking)

trans-unit.source: If VM agent is running fine, Learn about [troubleshooting VM Snapshot issues](#Troubleshoot-VM-Snapshot-Issues)
trans-unit.target: If VM agent is running fine, Learn about [troubleshooting VM Snapshot issues](#Troubleshoot-VM-Snapshot-Issues)

trans-unit.source: If the VM agent is not causing any issues, then restart the VM.
trans-unit.target: If the VM agent is not causing any issues, then restart the VM.

trans-unit.source: At times an incorrect VM state can cause issues and restarting the VM resets this "bad state"
trans-unit.target: At times an incorrect VM state can cause issues and restarting the VM resets this "bad state"

trans-unit.source: Backup
trans-unit.target: Backup

trans-unit.source: Backup failed with an internal error - Please retry the operation in a few minutes.
trans-unit.target: Backup failed with an internal error - Please retry the operation in a few minutes.

trans-unit.source: If the problem persists, contact Microsoft Support
trans-unit.target: If the problem persists, contact Microsoft Support

trans-unit.source: You can get this error for 2 reasons:
trans-unit.target: You can get this error for 2 reasons:

trans-unit.source: There is too much data to be copied.
trans-unit.target: There is too much data to be copied.

trans-unit.source: The original VM has been deleted and therefore backup cannot be taken.
trans-unit.target: The original VM has been deleted and therefore backup cannot be taken.

trans-unit.source: In order to keep the backup data for a deleted VM but stop the backup errors, Unprotect the VM and choose the option to keep the data.
trans-unit.target: In order to keep the backup data for a deleted VM but stop the backup errors, Unprotect the VM and choose the option to keep the data.

trans-unit.source: This will stop the backup schedule and also the recurring error messages.
trans-unit.target: This will stop the backup schedule and also the recurring error messages.

trans-unit.source: Backup
trans-unit.target: Backup

trans-unit.source: Failed to install the Azure Recovery Services extension on the selected item - VM Agent is a pre-requisite for Azure Recovery Services Extension.
trans-unit.target: Failed to install the Azure Recovery Services extension on the selected item - VM Agent is a pre-requisite for Azure Recovery Services Extension.

trans-unit.source: Please install the Azure VM agent and restart the registration operation
trans-unit.target: Please install the Azure VM agent and restart the registration operation

trans-unit.source: Check if the VM agent has been installed correctly.
trans-unit.target: Check if the VM agent has been installed correctly.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the flag on the VM config is set correctly.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the flag on the VM config is set correctly.

trans-unit.source: [Read more](#validating-vm-agent-installation) about VM agent installation, and how to validate the VM agent installation.
trans-unit.target: [Read more](#validating-vm-agent-installation) about VM agent installation, and how to validate the VM agent installation.

trans-unit.source: Backup
trans-unit.target: Backup

trans-unit.source: Command execution failed - Another operation is currently in progress on this item.
trans-unit.target: Command execution failed - Another operation is currently in progress on this item.

trans-unit.source: Please wait until the previous operation is completed, and then retry
trans-unit.target: Please wait until the previous operation is completed, and then retry

trans-unit.source: An existing backup or restore job for the VM is running, and a new job cannot be started while the existing job is running.
trans-unit.target: An existing backup or restore job for the VM is running, and a new job cannot be started while the existing job is running.

trans-unit.source: Backup
trans-unit.target: Backup

trans-unit.source: Extension installation failed with the error "COM+ was unable to talk to the Microsoft Distributed Transaction Coordinator
trans-unit.target: Extension installation failed with the error "COM+ was unable to talk to the Microsoft Distributed Transaction Coordinator

trans-unit.source: This usually means that the COM+ service is not running.
trans-unit.target: This usually means that the COM+ service is not running.

trans-unit.source: Contact Microsoft support for help on fixing this issue.
trans-unit.target: Contact Microsoft support for help on fixing this issue.

trans-unit.source: Backup
trans-unit.target: Backup

trans-unit.source: Snapshot operation failed with the VSS operation error "This drive is locked by BitLocker Drive Encryption.
trans-unit.target: Snapshot operation failed with the VSS operation error "This drive is locked by BitLocker Drive Encryption.

trans-unit.source: You must unlock this drive from Control Panel.
trans-unit.target: You must unlock this drive from Control Panel.

trans-unit.source: Turn off BitLocker for all drives on the VM and observe if the VSS issue is resolved
trans-unit.target: Turn off BitLocker for all drives on the VM and observe if the VSS issue is resolved

trans-unit.source: Backup
trans-unit.target: Backup

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines having virtual hard disks stored on Premium storage are not supported for backup
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines having virtual hard disks stored on Premium storage are not supported for backup

trans-unit.source: None
trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.source: Backup
trans-unit.target: Backup

trans-unit.source: Azure Virtual Machine Not Found.
trans-unit.target: Azure Virtual Machine Not Found.

trans-unit.source: This happens when the primary VM is deleted but the backup policy continues to look for a VM to perform backup.
trans-unit.target: This happens when the primary VM is deleted but the backup policy continues to look for a VM to perform backup.

trans-unit.source: To fix this error:
trans-unit.target: To fix this error:

trans-unit.source: Recreate the virtual machine with the same name and same resource group name [cloud service name],
trans-unit.target: Recreate the virtual machine with the same name and same resource group name [cloud service name],

trans-unit.source: (OR)
trans-unit.target: (OR)

trans-unit.source: Disable protection for this VM so that backup jobs will not be created
trans-unit.target: Disable protection for this VM so that backup jobs will not be created

trans-unit.target: Backup

trans-unit.target: Virtual machine agent is not present on the virtual machine - Please install the required pre-requisite, VM agent and restart the operation.

trans-unit.target: Restore

trans-unit.source: Restore failed with Cloud Internal error
trans-unit.target: Restore failed with Cloud Internal error

trans-unit.source: Cloud service to which you are trying to restore is configured with DNS settings.
trans-unit.target: Cloud service to which you are trying to restore is configured with DNS settings.

trans-unit.source: You can check
trans-unit.target: You can check

trans-unit.source: $deployment = Get-AzureDeployment -ServiceName "ServiceName" -Slot "Production" Get-AzureDns -DnsSettings $deployment.DnsSettings
trans-unit.target: $deployment = Get-AzureDeployment -ServiceName "ServiceName" -Slot "Production" Get-AzureDns -DnsSettings $deployment.DnsSettings

trans-unit.source: If there is Address configured, this means that DNS settings are configured.
trans-unit.target: If there is Address configured, this means that DNS settings are configured.

trans-unit.source: Cloud service to which to you are trying to restore is configured with ReservedIP and existing VMs in cloud service are in stopped state.
trans-unit.target: Cloud service to which to you are trying to restore is configured with ReservedIP and existing VMs in cloud service are in stopped state.

trans-unit.source: You can check a cloud service has reserved IP by using following powershell cmdlets:
trans-unit.target: You can check a cloud service has reserved IP by using following powershell cmdlets:

trans-unit.source: $deployment = Get-AzureDeployment -ServiceName "servicename" -Slot "Production" $dep.ReservedIPName
trans-unit.target: $deployment = Get-AzureDeployment -ServiceName "servicename" -Slot "Production" $dep.ReservedIPName

trans-unit.source: You are trying to restore a virtual machine with following special network configurations in to same cloud service.
trans-unit.target: You are trying to restore a virtual machine with following special network configurations in to same cloud service.

trans-unit.source: - Virtual machines under load balancer configuration ( Internal adn external)
trans-unit.target: - Virtual machines under load balancer configuration ( Internal adn external)

trans-unit.source: - Virtual machines with multiple Reserved IPs
trans-unit.target: - Virtual machines with multiple Reserved IPs

trans-unit.source: - Virtual machines with multiple NICs
trans-unit.target: - Virtual machines with multiple NICs

trans-unit.source: Please select a new cloud service in the UI or please refer to [restore considerations](backup-azure-restore-vms.md/#restoring-vms-with-special-network-configurations) for VMs with special network configurations
trans-unit.target: Please select a new cloud service in the UI or please refer to [restore considerations](backup-azure-restore-vms.md/#restoring-vms-with-special-network-configurations) for VMs with special network configurations

trans-unit.source: Restore
trans-unit.target: Restore

trans-unit.source: The selected DNS name is already taken - Please specify a different DNS name and try again.
trans-unit.target: The selected DNS name is already taken - Please specify a different DNS name and try again.

trans-unit.source: The DNS name here refers to the cloud service name (usually ending with .cloudapp.net).
trans-unit.target: The DNS name here refers to the cloud service name (usually ending with .cloudapp.net).

trans-unit.source: This needs to be unique.
trans-unit.target: This needs to be unique.

trans-unit.source: If you encounter this error, you need to choose a different VM name during restore.
trans-unit.target: If you encounter this error, you need to choose a different VM name during restore.

trans-unit.source: Note that this error is shown only to users of the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Note that this error is shown only to users of the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: The restore operation through PowerShell will succeed because it only restores the disks and doesn't create the VM.
trans-unit.target: The restore operation through PowerShell will succeed because it only restores the disks and doesn't create the VM.

trans-unit.source: The error will be faced when the VM is explicitly created by you after the disk restore operation.
trans-unit.target: The error will be faced when the VM is explicitly created by you after the disk restore operation.

trans-unit.target: Restore

trans-unit.target: The specified virtual network configuration is not correct - Please specify a different virtual network configuration and try again.

trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.target: Restore

trans-unit.target: Backup vault and target storage account are in two different regions - Ensure that the storage account specified in restore operation is in the same Azure region as the backup vault.

trans-unit.source: VM Agent
trans-unit.target: VM Agent

trans-unit.source: Setting up the VM Agent
trans-unit.target: Setting up the VM Agent

trans-unit.source: Typically, the VM Agent is already present in VMs that are created from the Azure gallery.
trans-unit.target: Typically, the VM Agent is already present in VMs that are created from the Azure gallery.

trans-unit.source: However, virtual machines that are migrated from on-premises datacenters would not have the VM Agent installed.
trans-unit.target: However, virtual machines that are migrated from on-premises datacenters would not have the VM Agent installed.

trans-unit.source: For such VMs, the VM Agent needs to be installed explicitly.
trans-unit.target: For such VMs, the VM Agent needs to be installed explicitly.

trans-unit.source: Read more about [installing the VM agent on an existing VM](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/mast/archive/2014/04/08/install-the-vm-agent-on-an-existing-azure-vm.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Read more about [installing the VM agent on an existing VM](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/mast/archive/2014/04/08/install-the-vm-agent-on-an-existing-azure-vm.aspx).

trans-unit.source: For Windows VMs:
trans-unit.target: For Windows VMs:

trans-unit.source: Download and install the [agent MSI](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=394789&clcid=0x409).
trans-unit.target: Download and install the [agent MSI](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=394789&clcid=0x409).

trans-unit.source: You will need Administrator privileges to complete the installation.
trans-unit.target: You will need Administrator privileges to complete the installation.

trans-unit.source: [Update the VM property](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/mast/archive/2014/04/08/install-the-vm-agent-on-an-existing-azure-vm.aspx) to indicate that the agent is installed.
trans-unit.target: [Update the VM property](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/mast/archive/2014/04/08/install-the-vm-agent-on-an-existing-azure-vm.aspx) to indicate that the agent is installed.

trans-unit.source: For Linux VMs:
trans-unit.target: For Linux VMs:

trans-unit.source: Install latest [Linux agent](https://github.com/Azure/WALinuxAgent) from github.
trans-unit.target: Install latest [Linux agent](https://github.com/Azure/WALinuxAgent) from github.

trans-unit.source: [Update the VM property](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/mast/archive/2014/04/08/install-the-vm-agent-on-an-existing-azure-vm.aspx) to indicate that the agent is installed.
trans-unit.target: [Update the VM property](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/mast/archive/2014/04/08/install-the-vm-agent-on-an-existing-azure-vm.aspx) to indicate that the agent is installed.

trans-unit.source: Updating the VM Agent
trans-unit.target: Updating the VM Agent

trans-unit.source: For Windows VMs:
trans-unit.target: For Windows VMs:

trans-unit.source: Updating the VM Agent is as simple as reinstalling the [VM Agent binaries](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=394789&clcid=0x409).
trans-unit.target: Updating the VM Agent is as simple as reinstalling the [VM Agent binaries](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=394789&clcid=0x409).

trans-unit.source: However, you need to ensure that no backup operation is running while the VM Agent is being updated.
trans-unit.target: However, you need to ensure that no backup operation is running while the VM Agent is being updated.

trans-unit.source: For Linux VMs:
trans-unit.target: For Linux VMs:

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions on [Updating Linux VM Agent ](../virtual-machines/virtual-machines-linux-update-agent.md).
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions on [Updating Linux VM Agent ](../virtual-machines/virtual-machines-linux-update-agent.md).

trans-unit.source: Validating VM Agent installation
trans-unit.target: Validating VM Agent installation

trans-unit.source: How to check for the VM Agent version on Windows VMs:
trans-unit.target: How to check for the VM Agent version on Windows VMs:

trans-unit.source: Log on to the Azure virtual machine and navigate to the folder *C:\WindowsAzure\Packages*.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the Azure virtual machine and navigate to the folder *C:\WindowsAzure\Packages*.

trans-unit.source: You should find the WaAppAgent.exe file present.
trans-unit.target: You should find the WaAppAgent.exe file present.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the file, go to **Properties**, and then select the **Details** tab.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the file, go to **Properties**, and then select the **Details** tab.

trans-unit.source: The Product Version field should be 2.6.1198.718 or higher
trans-unit.target: The Product Version field should be 2.6.1198.718 or higher

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot VM Snapshot Issues
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot VM Snapshot Issues

trans-unit.source: VM backup relies on issuing snapshot command to underlying storage.
trans-unit.target: VM backup relies on issuing snapshot command to underlying storage.

trans-unit.source: Not having access to storage or delay in snapshot task execution can fail the backup.
trans-unit.target: Not having access to storage or delay in snapshot task execution can fail the backup.

trans-unit.source: The following can cause snapshot task failure.
trans-unit.target: The following can cause snapshot task failure.

trans-unit.source: Network access to Storage is blocked using NSG
trans-unit.target: Network access to Storage is blocked using NSG

trans-unit.source: Learn more on how to [enable network access](backup-azure-vms-prepare.md#2-network-connectivity) to Storage using either WhiteListing of IPs or through proxy server.
trans-unit.target: Learn more on how to [enable network access](backup-azure-vms-prepare.md#2-network-connectivity) to Storage using either WhiteListing of IPs or through proxy server.

trans-unit.source: VMs with Sql Server backup configured can cause snapshot task delay
trans-unit.target: VMs with Sql Server backup configured can cause snapshot task delay

trans-unit.source: By default VM backup issues VSS Full backup on Windows VMs.
trans-unit.target: By default VM backup issues VSS Full backup on Windows VMs.

trans-unit.source: On VMs which are running Sql Servers and Sql Server backup is configured, this might cause delay in snapshot execution.
trans-unit.target: On VMs which are running Sql Servers and Sql Server backup is configured, this might cause delay in snapshot execution.

trans-unit.source: Please set following registry key if you are experiencing backup failures because of snapshot issues.
trans-unit.target: Please set following registry key if you are experiencing backup failures because of snapshot issues.

trans-unit.source: VM status reported incorrectly because VM is shutdown in RDP.
trans-unit.target: VM status reported incorrectly because VM is shutdown in RDP.

trans-unit.source: If you have Shut down the virtual machine in RDP, please check back in the portal that VM status is reflected correctly.
trans-unit.target: If you have Shut down the virtual machine in RDP, please check back in the portal that VM status is reflected correctly.

trans-unit.source: If not, please shutdown the VM in portal using 'Shutdown' option in VM dashboard.
trans-unit.target: If not, please shutdown the VM in portal using 'Shutdown' option in VM dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Many VMs from same cloud service are configured to backup at the same time.
trans-unit.target: Many VMs from same cloud service are configured to backup at the same time.

trans-unit.source: It is best practice to spread the VMs from same cloud service to have different backup schedules.
trans-unit.target: It is best practice to spread the VMs from same cloud service to have different backup schedules.

trans-unit.source: VM is running at High CPU/Memory.
trans-unit.target: VM is running at High CPU/Memory.

trans-unit.source: If the virtual machine is running at High CPU usage(>90%) or memory, snapshot task is queued, delayed and wil eventually gets timed-out.
trans-unit.target: If the virtual machine is running at High CPU usage(>90%) or memory, snapshot task is queued, delayed and wil eventually gets timed-out.

trans-unit.source: Try on-demand backup in such situations.
trans-unit.target: Try on-demand backup in such situations.

trans-unit.source: Networking
trans-unit.target: Networking

trans-unit.source: Like all extensions, Backup extension need access to the public internet to work.
trans-unit.target: Like all extensions, Backup extension need access to the public internet to work.

trans-unit.source: Not having access to the public internet can manifest itself in a variety of ways:
trans-unit.target: Not having access to the public internet can manifest itself in a variety of ways:

trans-unit.source: The extension installation can fail
trans-unit.target: The extension installation can fail

trans-unit.source: The backup operations (like disk snapshot) can fail
trans-unit.target: The backup operations (like disk snapshot) can fail

trans-unit.source: Displaying the status of the backup operation can fail
trans-unit.target: Displaying the status of the backup operation can fail

trans-unit.source: The need for resolving public internet addresses has been articulated [here](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/mast/archive/2014/06/18/azure-vm-provisioning-stuck-on-quot-installing-extensions-on-virtual-machine-quot.aspx).
trans-unit.target: The need for resolving public internet addresses has been articulated [here](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/mast/archive/2014/06/18/azure-vm-provisioning-stuck-on-quot-installing-extensions-on-virtual-machine-quot.aspx).

trans-unit.source: You will need to check the DNS configurations for the VNET and ensure that the Azure URIs can be resolved.
trans-unit.target: You will need to check the DNS configurations for the VNET and ensure that the Azure URIs can be resolved.

trans-unit.source: Once the name resolution is done correctly, access to the Azure IPs also needs to be provided.
trans-unit.target: Once the name resolution is done correctly, access to the Azure IPs also needs to be provided.

trans-unit.source: To unblock access to the Azure infrastructure, follow one of these steps:
trans-unit.target: To unblock access to the Azure infrastructure, follow one of these steps:

trans-unit.source: WhiteList the Azure datacenter IP ranges.
trans-unit.target: WhiteList the Azure datacenter IP ranges.

trans-unit.source: Get the list of [Azure datacenter IPs](https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=41653) to be whitelisted.
trans-unit.target: Get the list of [Azure datacenter IPs](https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=41653) to be whitelisted.

trans-unit.source: Unblock the IPs using the [New-NetRoute](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh826148.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Unblock the IPs using the [New-NetRoute](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh826148.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Run this cmdlet within the Azure VM, in an elevated PowerShell window (run as Administrator).
trans-unit.target: Run this cmdlet within the Azure VM, in an elevated PowerShell window (run as Administrator).

trans-unit.source: Add rules to the NSG (if you have one in place) to allow access to the IPs.
trans-unit.target: Add rules to the NSG (if you have one in place) to allow access to the IPs.

trans-unit.source: Create a path for HTTP traffic to flow
trans-unit.target: Create a path for HTTP traffic to flow

trans-unit.source: If you have some network restriction in place (a Network Security Group, for example) deploy an HTTP proxy server to route the traffic.
trans-unit.target: If you have some network restriction in place (a Network Security Group, for example) deploy an HTTP proxy server to route the traffic.

trans-unit.source: Steps to deploy a HTTP Proxy server can found [here](backup-azure-vms-prepare.md#2-network-connectivity).
trans-unit.target: Steps to deploy a HTTP Proxy server can found [here](backup-azure-vms-prepare.md#2-network-connectivity).

trans-unit.source: Add rules to the NSG (if you have one in place) to allow access to the INTERNET from the HTTP Proxy.
trans-unit.target: Add rules to the NSG (if you have one in place) to allow access to the INTERNET from the HTTP Proxy.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] DHCP must be enabled inside the guest for IaaS VM Backup to work.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] DHCP must be enabled inside the guest for IaaS VM Backup to work.

trans-unit.source: If you need a static private IP, you should configure it through the platform.
trans-unit.target: If you need a static private IP, you should configure it through the platform.

trans-unit.source: The DHCP option inside the VM should be left enabled.
trans-unit.target: The DHCP option inside the VM should be left enabled.

trans-unit.source: View more information about [Setting a Static Internal Private IP](../virtual-network/virtual-networks-reserved-private-ip.md).
trans-unit.target: View more information about [Setting a Static Internal Private IP](../virtual-network/virtual-networks-reserved-private-ip.md).
